feed.title: SAP Community - ABAP Development
feed.subtitle: ABAP Development Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: RPCNETN0 page down button not working in subscreen
entry.content:
I need to create a program where I do a payroll simulation using program RPCNETN0.

After entering the employee number and using the Read Pers. Data button I need to enter additional payment wagetypes in the Payment TAB. I will be doing using this via BDCDATA. Since I don't know with how many records this subscreen will be filled after reading the data for the employee I want to to Use PAge down so afterwards I can use the first available row to add the extra data.

When I use the Page Down button in the subscreen however it does nothing, clicking on the scrollbar however does work (usually only if this is the first action I perform after going to the subscreen). I tried recording this using SHDB, but clicking on the scrollbar isn't something that is recorded.

Does anybody have experience with this kind of thing and maybe have a work-around for it.

entry.title: Difference between TYPE and LIKE in ABAP â€“ When to use what?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am a bit confused about the usage of  TYPE and LIKE in ABAP. I know both are used for declaring data objects, but I am not very clear on when exactly I should prefer TYPE and when LIKE.

Both seem to work, but I believe there are differences in behavior and best practices.

Can someone please explain in which scenarios we should go for TYPE and in which scenarios LIKE is the better choice? Some practical examples would be really helpful.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: ABAP2XLSX: Generic method to load any file into an internal table
entry.content:
Hello there.

Is there any method I can use to load files to internal tables in ABAP2XLSX ?

I mean, a method like FM ALSM_EXCEL_TO_INTERNAL_TABLE, that returns a table with fields: row, col and value.
But with an extra field:  worksheet_number, row, col and value.

I've read some post like this with specific solutions for a concrete internal table, but I would like to have a more generic method for any internal table.

https://adityaaufar.medium.com/most-common-use-case-of-abap2xlsx-excel-file-to-internal-table-92b3d1f6d710

If nothing similar exists, I will create a function for this, or perhaps, if you are interested, a new method in the ZCL_EXCEL_READER_2007 class.

Regards.

entry.title: How to fill data in changing parameter PNNNN_PRIMARY_TAB internal table
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am using Badi for successfactor in which primary_tab is a changing parameter. I want create a new record  to PNNNN_PRIMARY_TAB internal table

I found  this

https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-discussions/how-to-fill-data-in-changing-parameter-pnnnn-primary-tab-internal-table-in/td-p/616717 

LOOP AT <pnnnn_tab> ASSIGNING <pnnnn>.

*"I need to create a new record based on the existing record."I want a split of Infotype record, 

ENDLOOP.

entry.title: Add new record Dynamic Table Processing with Field Symbols
entry.content:
Hi

I need Add new record Dynamic Table Processing with Field Symbols, I want to create a new record based on the last record in the table

DATA: lv_table_name TYPE string VALUE 'SFLIGHT',
      lt_table      TYPE REF TO DATA.

FIELD-SYMBOLS: <lt_data> TYPE STANDARD TABLE, 
                            <fs_row> TYPE any.

* Create a dynamic internal table
CREATE DATA lt_table TYPE TABLE OF (lv_table_name).
ASSIGN lt_table->* TO <lt_data>.

* Fetch data dynamically
SELECT * FROM (lv_table_name) INTO TABLE <lt_data> UP TO 5 ROWS.

* Loop dynamically
LOOP AT <lt_data> ASSIGNING <fs_row>.
  *I want to create a new record based on the last record in the table
ENDLOOP.

entry.title: Dump BEHAVIOR_ILLEGAL_STMT_IN_CALL
entry.content:
Hello,

I am working on an On-Premise S/4HANA system and developing an application using the language version "ABAP for Cloud Development".

I am currently using the released BAdI FKK_BADI_RETURN_LOT (FKK_EVENT_0295). For this purpose, I have added the function module FKK_SAMPLE_0295_CLOUD_BADI to event 295 in FQ-Events and created a BAdI implementation. 

Within this implementation, I attempt to write data to the database with the following statement:

INSERT zal000 FROM ls_data.

However, this leads to a short dump. Interestingly, when I execute the same logic in a BAdI implementation developed with the language version "Standard-ABAP", it works without any issues.

Question:
Where can I find official documentation that indicates whether a BAdI runs in the "Save" or "Late Save" phase in the context of ABAP for Cloud Development?

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,

A. Schulz

entry.title: How to count distinct numbers from a internal table using SAP ABAP 7.5 ?
entry.content:
Hi experts,

A simple internal table like this :

COMP      ID1       ID2

1000         A1        B1

1000         A1        B2

1000         A2        B2

1000         A3        B2

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The result I need is : 

COMP         COUNT(distinct ID1)         COUNT(distinct ID2)

1000                               3                                              2

 

How to achieve this using SAP ABAP 7.5 ?

Tks.

entry.title: In sap tm, for Freight Unit automatic creation can we generate multiple FUs with different quantity?
entry.content:
at the start we have an initial FU type when finalize Final FU type is generated.

In our current scenario 1 SO with 1 item & 60 units, during initial FU type.

When Final FU type trigger base on our custom criteria. we need to generate 3 FUs final type with different quantity.

FU 1 = 10 units, FU 2 = 30 units & FU 3 = 20 units. 

I have already an alternative approach.

I want to know if this possible for Badi and process controller only? 

we are currently applying standard strategy FUB_AUTO.

I have added a custom method after post processing in process controller

entry.title: modify dynamic field symbol
entry.content:
Row MANDT PERNR ENDDA BEGDA 
1 300 92002278 99991231
2 300 92002278 99991231 

I now need modify the date BEGDA | ENDDA an that the resulted is the following:
Row MANDT PERNR ENDDA BEGDA
1 300 92002278 20250921 20240823
2 300 92002278 99991231 20250922

Hello Experts,

I am getting issue while modifying dynamic field symbol.

I have the following program.

REPORT ZTEST.
PARAMETERS:p_table TYPE tabname.

DATA:lr_data TYPE REF TO data,
     lr_line TYPE REF TO data,
  lv_where      TYPE string VALUE 'PERNR = ''92002278'''.

FIELD-SYMBOLS:<fs_table> TYPE STANDARD TABLE,
              <fs_s>  TYPE ANY,
              <fs_line>  TYPE ANY.

CREATE DATA lr_data TYPE TABLE OF (p_table).
ASSIGN lr_data->* TO <fs_table>.
CREATE DATA lr_line LIKE LINE OF <fs_table>.
ASSIGN lr_line->* TO <fs_line>.

SELECT * FROM (p_table) INTO TABLE <fs_table> WHERE (lv_where).
APPEND  <fs_table>[ lines( <fs_table> ) ] TO <fs_table>.

s

Row MANDT PERNR ENDDA BEGDA 
1 300 92002278 99991231
2 300 92002278 99991231 

I now need modify the date BEGDA | ENDDA an that the resulted is the following:
Row MANDT PERNR ENDDA BEGDA
1 300 92002278 20250921 20240823
2 300 92002278 99991231 20250921

Regards

entry.title: Double Periods (". . ") Not Throwing Syntax Error In ABAP.
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am practicing ABAP and I have a small doubt regarding syntax.

In my code, I accidentally wrote:  IF sy-subrc = 0.
WRITE: 'Success'.
ENDIF..   

or at any ending statement if i give dot after the dot ( .. ), it gives me no syntax error and successfully activated the program. 

Is this expected behavior in ABAP? Why doesnâ€™t the system flag this as an error?
Would appreciate if someone could clarify the reasoning behind this.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: No physical path is configured for logical file name IBIP_LOG_FILE
entry.content:
Hello All,

I am working on a migration project, and I have an issue with LSMW. While executing Create Batch Input Session I came across an error "No physical path is configured for logical file name IBIP_LOG_FILE". 

I have maintained the physical path in FILE transaction for both UNIX and windows NT as mentioned below

I have gone through a post where they have maintained the logical path and logical file in specify file step only as mentioned below.

But I am not able to see this step I can only see the option to provide the file name

Is this feature based on any version? Currently I am working on S4 core 108 and LSMW version  4.0.0.  Please suggest resolving this issue.

Thanks

Pallavi

entry.title: Security related ATC checks, nonsense of pseudo comments
entry.content:
Hi all,

I want to use ATC security checks to identify certain security vulnerables like usage of GENERATE REPORT, GENERATE SUBROUINE POOL and others. I found there are already ATC checks available for, but they can be easily suppressed by pseudo comment

"#EC CI_GENERATE.

In my opinion, it absolutely makes no sense to be able supress certain ATC checks by pseudo comments. In some cases it makes sense (like BAPI call with material length check). But for security related topics, it is dangerous in my opinion. Instead, ATC exemption should be used for this imo.

If you employ unfriendly/enemy developers (i.e., by external partner), they simply add pseudo comments to cheat on ATC check. This makes it more challenging in identifying vulnerable code as I can't trust ATC checks here.

Is there a way to overcome this issue (beside replacing developers)

entry.title: Create Z program to update EDPAR entries
entry.content:
Hello team, 

We currently update EDPAR entries using transaction VOE4 , but each time we have to ask the Basis team to open the client after approval. This process takes time. We would like to create a Z program to handle this instead.

Can anyone advise? Should we use BDC for VOE4, or is there a relevant function module available?

Thank you very much.

entry.title: Is there an ABAP equivalent of JavaDocs for SAP classes and methods?
entry.content:
Hi all,

In Java, they have Javadocs  that provide a complete API reference for classes, listing all methods, parameters, return types, and usage examples. Iâ€™m looking for something similar in ABAP.  

Specifically, is there an official SAP documentation page that provides a Javadoc-style API reference for standard ABAP classes? i.e. the equivalent of https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/

entry.title: FIORI APP extensibility
entry.content:
I need to extend a standard Fiori application with a custom field. Normally, the recommended approach would be to use the Custom Fields and Logic app, which automatically creates a new field (with the ZZ1_ prefix) in the relevant table and exposes it to Fiori.

However, in my case, the situation is different:

The customer has already added a custom field ZCLASS in table MARD using an append structure and this field is already in use across multiple forms, reports (so itâ€™s business critical)

If I use the Custom Fields and Logic app now, it will create a new field ZZ1_CLASS in MARD, which would lead to redundant fields for the same purpose.

My question is what is the correct approach to resolve this issue?

Thank you In advance
